results.title: Lacock
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place in the Country”.
Part of a series of films made in co-operation with the National Trust, this episode looks at Lacock through the eyes of the family who has lived there.

results.title: Labrador Hospital
results.creator_credit: Rex Tasker, ONF | NFB and Kryn Taconis
results.brief_description: A documentary study of the Grenfell Mission, a voluntary medical group that has served Atlantic fishermen and the isolated communities of Newfoundland and Labrador since 1892. Focus of the film is the Mission’s headquarters hospital at St. Anthony and the modern system of airlifting up to 5000 patients a year to hospital.

results.title: Labour of Love
results.creator_credit: Martyn Down, Imago, Pumpkin Films and Harriet Clutterbuck
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the positive aspects of home childbirth following the experiences of several families. Interviews their midwives about the advantages of having a baby amongst family and friends in familiar surroundings.

results.title: Labour and capital mobility (NP)
results.creator_credit: Craig Saunders, Ashley Schwall-Kearney, Monash University, ABC-TV (Australia) and Open Learning Agency of Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Global Economy”.
The increasing globalisation of the international economy has resulted in labour shifting across the globe in search of employment opportunities. This episode of the Open Learning Economics course examines national economies reliant emigration and immigration cycles. The first half of the program examines the relationship between the Netherlands and Turkey. In the late 1960s Holland began to accept a large number of Turkish immigrants who were leaving their home country due to the decimation of the traditional agricultural economy. For Holland, the Turkish people provided a pool of cheap labour, while for Turkey, its economy became dependant on the wages the immigrants sent back to their home country. The second part showcases Mexico and United States where in order to alleviate the social problems caused by extensive Mexican immigrant labour in the US, the two countries have entered into an economic union which allows American companies to move their capital to Mexico. The panel discussion looks at the ramifications of this agreement (part of the North American Free Trade Agreement - NAFTA) on unemployment and labour relations in both the “host” and “home” nations.

results.title: Labor in power
results.creator_credit: Sue Spencer and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: In a decade of profound change, from 1983 to 1993, the ABC Television News and Current Affairs Political Documentary Unit compiled a unique series, capturing the key elements of the Australian Labour Party’s ten-year rule. The battle between Bob Hawke and Paul Keating for the Labor Party leadership was one of the most divisive in Australian political history the seeds of which can be traced back as far as 1980. The series is an intensely personal examination of the Hawke-Keating relationship, and through more than 120 interviews with Cabinet Ministers, senior bureaucrats and staff advisers, the series offers an insider’s view of who wields power in Australia, and how. The five episodes are; “Taking power”, “Taxing times”, “Conserving power”, “The recession we had to have” and “The sweetest victory”.

results.title: Labirynt
results.creator_credit: Studio Miniatur Filmowych, Warszawie Przedstawia Film and Jan Lenica
results.brief_description: Jan Lenica’s diverse animation techniques in this film create a cruel and absurd world from which escape is impossible - anyone caught up in this Kafka-like nightmare can only persist, undeterred.

results.title: La Trobe Cottage [B&W]
results.creator_credit: National Trust, John Kingsford-Smith, Ampol Petroleum Ltd and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Heritage”.
A look at La Trobe Cottage, Victoria’s first Government House. Brought out from England, it was assembled on a foundation of hand-make bricks.

results.title: La Trace = the Trail
results.brief_description:
Joseph is a young Savoyard peasant who makes a living by crossing the Alps into Italy in the winter months selling his wares to the villagers. This story traces a winter’s itinerary as the man encounters various adventures in his always dangerous journey, but he remains oblivious to all the nuances and reverberations of social change going on around him. When he finally returns to his family after many months away, he discovers to his surprise that his village is now a part of France and it looks like a Savoyard would soon be sitting on the throne of a unified Italy. The film was originally shot in wide screen format. This copy is presented in standard screen ratio 3:4.

Credits: Producer, Claude Nedjar ; director, Bernard Favre ; writers, Bernard Favre, Bertrand Tavernier ; photography, Jean-Francis Gondre ; music, Marc Perrone, Nicola Piovani.
Cast: Richard Berry, Berangere Bonvoisin, Sophie Chemineau, Marc Perrone, Robin Renucci.

results.title: La Sylphide
results.brief_description: La Sylphide, in diaphanous white costume and with shining wings, dances for the Scottish farmer James, in the first scene of this most famous and enduring ballet by August Bournonville. This production by the Royal Dutch Ballet was partly recorded in the atmosphere of live performance but essentially in the confines of an empty Royal Theatre. The orchestra is conducted by Paul Jorgensen.
